name: Titanium.UI.RefreshControl
summary: The RefreshControl is a representation of the native iOS UIRefreshControl and Android SwipeRefreshLayout.

events.name: refreshstart
events.summary: Fired in response to a user initiated an action to refresh the contents of the table view, list view or scroll view.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: This is false. This event does not bubble

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: refreshend
events.summary: Fired in response to a user finished action to refresh the contents of the table view, list view or scroll view.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: This is false. This event does not bubble

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: beginRefreshing
methods.summary: Tells the control that a refresh operation was started programmatically.
methods.description: Call this method when an external event source triggers a programmatic refresh of your table. This method updates the state of the refresh control to reflect the in-progress refresh operation. When the refresh operation ends, be sure to call the endRefreshing method to return the control to its default state. Note: When triggering the refreshing programmatically, the styling is not applied and the refresh control is tinted in the native gray.

methods.name: endRefreshing
methods.summary: Tells the control that a refresh operation has ended.
methods.description: Call this method at the end of any refresh operation (whether it was initiated programmatically or by the user) to return the refresh control to its default state.

properties.name: tintColor
properties.summary: The tint color for the refresh control, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title text is only supported on iOS. Android will ignore this property.
